ShortDescription.Value: Find It is a mod that lets you quickly browse and search for all of the assets inside of the game.

Publish.LongDescription:
# Find It for Cities: Skylines II Quickly browse and search through all of the assets inside of the game.
Use **Ctrl+F** to quickly open the Find It panel, or click on the magnifier icon in your toolbar.
Use **Ctrl+P** to enable the Picker tool, or click on the picker icon in your toolbar.
Use **Ctrl+R** to select a random asset from the list, or click on the random button in the Find It panel.
Huge thanks to **YenYang** for their help on the UI.
Special thanks to **Algernon** for their contribution and allowing me to take on this project
Thank you to **Chameleon** for providing the Icons.
And thank you to **Baka-gourd** (NullPinter) for their help with focus.
## Features * Quick and intelligent search methods. * Extensive sorting and filtering options. * Extensive and comprehensive asset categories. * Align the panel to the right to have unobstructed view of what you're working on. * Panel stays open while placing assets, no jumping between different tabs. * Tool options like Tree Controller and Line Tool are fully supported and can be used while the panel is open. * Favorite your most used assets. * Integrated Picker
## Planned Features * Custom tagging, add your own tags to assets. Will also come with cross compatibility with Skyve. * Asset information when hovering over an item.
## Notes Find It should automatically support any mods that add or alter the vanilla assets.
If you're having any issues, please report them on my discord as it's easier to help you that way.
Publish.ChangeLog:
# v1.2.0 ## New & Changed * Added a 'lock' toggle to keep Find It open all the time, until you unlock it back. * Moved Service Buildings into their own category and added sub-categories per service type. * Added a no-pack filter to only show assets that do not have a pack. * You can now select multiple asset packs at a time. * Zone-type icons on assets no longer gets hidden when going into a specific zoning sub-category. * Made selected options easier to distinguish for large icons like region packs and CCPs.
## Fixes * Fixed tool options size taking the whole screen if using mods that add a slider. * Fixed the 'Base Game' dlc filter counting PDX Mods assets as base-game too.
